p: The ET decreased with increasing CO 2 alone at both locations under four climate scenarios. The reason for these differences is that elevated CO 2 can lead to a decrease in stomatal conductance which would result in lower ET values and increased leaf temperatures [ 60]. In DSSAT-CERES modules, photosynthesis of plant leaves was computed hourly using the asymptotic exponential response equation, where quantum efficiency and light-saturated photosynthesis rate variables were dependent on CO 2 and temperature [ 11, 61]. In addition, our results showed that the ET increased with increasing temperatures which were in agreement with Wang et al. [ 20].
